title: No, photo of convoy not ‘Kenyatta going for haircut’ – it’s hearses carrying MH17 crash victims
subtitle: A Facebook user has
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
of the Netherlands and President

In the first, the Dutch leader is seen riding a bicycle. The second shows a line of over two dozen vehicles taking up one side of a highway – Kenyatta “going in a convoy for a haircut”.

: “Prime Minister of Netherlands Mark Rutte on a bicycle going to work while on the right picture is President of Kenya Uhuru Kenyatta going in a convoy for a haircut.”

It was posted on a

with over 89,000 followers, where it’s attracted some 180 reactions, dozens of comments and 200 shares. It’s also been

on a page with over 130,000 members.

The first photo is of Rutte riding a bike, as he

. But the image of the convoy isn’t Kenyatta going for a haircut.

reveals the photo is of a

transporting the remains of people killed in the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 plane crash to a military base in the Netherlands on 24 July 2014.

The plane was travelling from the Dutch city of Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia when it

on 17 July 2014, killing all 298 people on board. The aircraft was

is one of

from the event available as stock news photography on

. It is labelled “repatriation of the victims from Malaysia Airlines MH17 crash”.
